meanings.definition: The act of holding or supporting something gently in the arms or on the lap.
meanings.sent1: She cradled the injured bird in her hands.
meanings.sent2: The mother cradled her baby to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The kitten cradled the toy mouse in its paws.
meanings.sent4: The sun cradled the earth in its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The old man cradled his memories close to his heart.

meanings.definition: The act of rocking or soothing a baby or young child.
meanings.sent1: He gently cradled the crying baby in his arms.
meanings.sent2: The lullaby cradled the baby into a peaceful slumber.
meanings.sent3: The gentle breeze cradled the child to sleep in the hammock.
meanings.sent4: The waves cradled the child as they rocked gently on the boat.
meanings.sent5: The soft melody of the music cradled the baby in comfort.

meanings.definition: The small bed or basket used for holding a baby while sleeping or resting.
meanings.sent1: The baby slept soundly in the cradling bassinet.
meanings.sent2: The cradling crib provided a safe place for the infant to rest.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot in the cradling basket to nap.
meanings.sent4: The cradling hammock swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cradling nest kept the baby bird warm and protected.
